result.execSummary:
The defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Milwaukee County Cases 15CM3086 and 15CM661, but consecutive to any other sentence; release ONLY for inmate work assignments within the House of Correction and The Day Reporting Center, no other release privileges; with credit for 2 days (05-23-2015 to 05-24-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail on deposit to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

- Regularly participation in an HSED or GED program as determined appropriate by DOC 
- Maintain employment as determined appropriate by DOC.

- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
 - No contact with Target at 2600 S. 108th Street, West Allis, WI.
- No contact with Kohl's at 9035 S. Howell Ave, Oak Creek, WI.

- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
 - Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- Mental health evaluation and any mental health treatment recommended by DOC.
- Court suggests Trauma Informed Mental Health Evaluation.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first year of probation.

timeConds.notes:
- Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments at the House of correction. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. This is stayed to use as follows: 
if any violation of positive use of alcohol or durg test without a valid prescription to serve 6 MONTHS.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elwood Eugene Bennett Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST FOR CIVIL JUDGMENT RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Student Intern Carlos Pedraza under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent with Milwaukee County Cases 15CM3086 and 15CM661, but consecutive to any other sentence; release ONLY for inmate work assignments within the House of Correction and The Day Reporting Center, no other release privileges; with credit for 2 days (05-23-2015 to 05-24-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first year of probation.
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional. 
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Regularly participation in an HSED or GED program as determined appropriate by DOC 
- Maintain employment as determined appropriate by DOC. 
- No contact with Target at 2600 S. 108th Street, West Allis, WI.
- No contact with Kohl's at 9035 S. Howell Ave, Oak Creek, WI. 
- Mental health evulation and any mental health treatment recommended by DOC.
- Court suggests Trauma Informed Mental Health Evaluation.
- Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments at the House of correction. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. This is stayed to use as follows: if any violation of positive use of alcohol or durg test without a valid prescription to serve 6 MONTHS.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail on deposit to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.    Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 17.  Firearms warnings given. Voting admonishment given. DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for final pretrial. Defense received a new offer and request an adjournment. Court will allow for final adjournment. Case set for final pretrial on 01-25-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17. Jury trial remains scheduled for 02-24-2016.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

State's Witness List
State's Motion in Limine
State's requested Jury Instructions, received and filed. tk

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  
Danielle Chojnacki for Brandon Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Deferred prosecution agreement.  Defendant has new charges pending in Branch 45.  Parties inform the court that the state has rescinded its offer.  Parties engaged in negotiations for global resolution.  The Court to set this matter for jury trial at this time.   This Court has no objection to accepting the misdemeanor cases for resolution before this court if approved by Branch 45.  If resolution is not reached/completed on or before the final pretrial the misdemeanor cases shall return to Branch 45 and this matter will proceed to trial before Branch 17. Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Danielle Chojnacki for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is looking for a monitoring agency. Case adjourned for  DPA hearing.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Branch 17 in jury trial.  Case spun to Branch 7.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Arguments heard as to bail. Court reinstated $75.00 Cash bail with all conditons to remain the same. Case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing on 10-27-2018 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case to be heard on 09-16-2015 at 8:30 for bail hearing.

Defense requests a Plea Hearing. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 17. Due to court being down, case calendared off master calendar.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Due to defendant's other case being heard in this court, Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 75.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court. Paul Hauer on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court lifted stay on and ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report dated July 23, 2015 received and filed. tk

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report: Missed Telephone Contact, received and filed. tk 
Court will take no action at this time.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Defense request a plea date. Court ordered case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing, Branch 17. Court notes no objection to case 15CM661 being transferred to Branch 17, if approved by Court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in custody.  David Behm for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
